page.title: 14AIRPORT
page.content: The Airport was first used by the R.A.F. in 1941-45. The runways,several metres in depth are reinforced with steel and are 300 metres in length. It cost 10 million pounds to build a runway like Teesside. The RAF chose to build it there because the land was flat and the weather not too much of a hindrance as land was too far away from the hills and sea to be affected by fog. In 1964 it became a civil airport. At Teesside Airport 24-25 planes land each day. Teesside Airport can hold any size plane,it has even had a visit by Concorde. It can also accomodate Boeing 747's and DC 10's.
